Waterbear Field School

Hands-on community workshops and projects focusing on energy, water, food, shelter, climate, communication, fabrication, transport, arts & crafts.

Our workshops are typically held outdoors, in most weather. Pricing, format, and location vary by workshop and by teacher. Click on a workshop below to find out more!

A Gentle Introduction to Local Energy Resilience

A hands-on introduction to human-scale renewable energy‚Äîbuild intuition for what's possible and learn practical approaches to generating and using power off-grid.

Ongoing projects and upcoming workshops. If you'd be interested to attend (or teach) any of them ‚Äî or have ideas for other projects ‚Äî please reach out!

Future Workshop

Bike Maintenance Basics

Learn essential bike maintenance and repair skills for keeping your bicycle in top condition
üå± Food
Future Workshop

Building a Cob Oven

Build an outdoor clay oven for baking bread, pizza, and more using ancient techniques. (Image: Wikipedia)
üì° Communication
Future Workshop

Building a DIY 4G Phone

Build your own open-source mobile phone with calls, texts, and only the features you choose
üîß Fabrication
Future Workshop

Cardboard Fabrication

Build creative structures from cardboard using a solar-powered nibbler and kid-safe tools
üå¨Ô∏è Air
Future Workshop

DIY Air Filtration

Learn how to build and assess simple, low-cost, effective DIY air purifiers.
üö≤ Transport
Future Workshop

DIY Bike Trailers

Build a low-cost cargo bike trailer from readily-available hardware store materials
üå¨Ô∏è Air
Future Workshop

DIY CO2 Monitoring

Building a low-cost DIY CO2 monitor with graphing and local storage
üå± Food
Future Workshop

DIY Cold Frames

Build a cold frame from reclaimed windows for season extension gardening
üîß Fabrication
Future Workshop

DIY Printing Press

Create your own printing blocks and print custom designs on paper
üå°Ô∏è Heating/Cooling
Future Workshop

Heating Small Spaces Off-Grid

Learn to estimate energy needs for heating tiny homes, animal shelters, and off-grid spaces using hands-on experiments and basic heat transfer principles.
üîß Fabrication
Future Workshop

Intro to Sandcasting

Learn the ancient art of casting metal objects using sand molds. (Image: Wikipedia)
üîß Fabrication
Future Workshop

Introduction to Welding

Learn basic welding skills while creating a musical Butaphone instrument from a gas bottle
üíß Water
Future Workshop

Making Biochar Water Filters

Build a low-cost water filtration system using locally-produced biochar. (Image: Kearns et al, 2023)
üì° Communication
Future Workshop

Off-Grid Monitoring of Temperature (and other things!) using local, low-power radios

Tracking e.g. the temperature of a hoop house, or the water level in a tank, without using cellular or wifi networks.
üíß Water
Future Workshop

Off-Grid Water Level Monitoring

Build solar-powered sensors to track water levels in wells, streams, and tanks
üé® Arts & Crafts
Future Workshop

Wire Sculpture

Create 3D forms from wire using techniques inspired by artists like Ruth Asawa and Ariel Matisse. (Image: Wikipedia)
üíß Water

UV254 Spectrophotometer

Building a low-cost UV spectrophotometer for assessing water filter effectiveness and dissolved organic matter in drinking water.
üíß Water

Water Storage Monitoring

Satellite modem-based water level monitoring for remote ranch tanks using LoRa sensors and ultrasonic depth measurement.
üíß Water

Biochar Water Filters

DIY water filtration systems using locally-produced biochar, based on designs by Aqueous Solutions and Dr. Josh Kearns.
üö≤ Transport

Crate Carts for Small Farms

Low-cost DIY carts for transporting vegetable crates, using recycled bicycle wheels and electrical conduit.
üå¨Ô∏è Air

CO2 Ventilation Assessment

Using CO2 monitors to assess indoor ventilation rates and air quality for healthier indoor spaces.
üå¨Ô∏è Air

DIY Air Purifiers

Building effective, low-cost air purifiers using box fans and MERV-13 filters - the Corsi-Rosenthal box design.
